# Terms of Service

**Last updated:** January 25, 2026
**Version:** 2026-01-25

---

## 1. Acceptance of Terms

By accessing or using the Picks4All platform ("the Platform", "the Service", "we", "us"), you agree to be legally bound by these Terms of Service ("Terms"). If you do not agree with any of these terms, you must not use the Service.

These Terms constitute a legally binding agreement between you ("User", "you") and the operators of the Platform.

---

## 2. Description of the Service

### 2.1 Nature of the Service

The Platform is an entertainment service that allows users to:

- Create and participate in "pools" (prediction groups) about sporting events
- Make predictions ("picks") about match results
- Compete with other users on leaderboards
- Manage private groups of friends, family, or communities

### 2.2 Important Statement: NOT Betting or Gambling

**THE PLATFORM IS NOT A BETTING OR GAMBLING SITE.**

- No real money is required or accepted to participate in predictions
- No monetary prizes are awarded through the Platform
- Predictions are purely recreational and for entertainment purposes
- The Platform does not facilitate, promote, or associate with gambling activities

Any prizes, rewards, or recognition that pool organizers choose to award are the sole responsibility of said organizers and are conducted outside the scope of the Platform.

---

## 3. Eligibility and Registration

### 3.1 Age Requirements

To use the Platform, you must:

- Be at least **13 years of age**
- If under 18 years of age, have the consent of your parents or legal guardians

### 3.2 User Account

By registering, you agree to:

- Provide truthful, current, and complete information
- Maintain the confidentiality of your access credentials
- Be responsible for all activities conducted with your account
- Notify us immediately of any unauthorized use

### 3.3 One Account per User

Each individual may maintain only one active account. Creating multiple accounts may result in the suspension or termination of all associated accounts.

---

## 4. Acceptable Use

### 4.1 User Conduct

By using the Platform, you agree to:

- Comply with all applicable laws and regulations
- Respect other users and maintain a cordial environment
- Not use offensive, discriminatory, or threatening language
- Not attempt to manipulate, hack, or compromise the security of the Service
- Not use bots, automated scripts, or scraping tools
- Not impersonate other individuals

### 4.2 User Content

Usernames, display names, and any content you generate:

- Must not be offensive, discriminatory, or inappropriate
- Must not infringe on third-party rights (trademarks, copyrights, etc.)
- Must not contain personal information of third parties without their consent

### 4.3 Prohibited Use

The following is expressly prohibited:

- Using the Platform for illegal activities
- Attempting to access other users' accounts
- Distributing malware or malicious code
- Reverse-engineering the software
- Reselling or commercializing access to the Service
- Using the Platform to organize real-money betting

---

## 5. Pools and Predictions

### 5.1 Creating Pools

Users may create pools as "Hosts". The Host is responsible for:

- Configuring pool rules (scoring system, deadlines, etc.)
- Managing pool membership
- Publishing official match results
- Maintaining a fair environment for all participants

### 5.2 Participating in Pools

Participants ("Players") agree to:

- Comply with the specific rules of each pool
- Submit their predictions before the established deadlines
- Accept the results published by the Host
- Respect the decisions of pool administrators

### 5.3 Deadlines

- Predictions must be submitted before the configured deadline for each match
- Once the deadline has passed, predictions cannot be modified
- The default deadline is 10 minutes before the match kickoff

### 5.4 Results and Scoring

- Hosts publish the official results for each match
- Scoring is calculated automatically according to configured rules
- Error corrections ("errata") are recorded with full traceability

---

## 6. Intellectual Property

### 6.1 Our Property

The Platform, including its code, design, logos, text, and features, is the property of its operators and is protected by intellectual property laws.

### 6.2 License to Use

We grant you a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable, and revocable license to use the Platform solely for your personal and non-commercial use, subject to these Terms.

### 6.3 Third-Party Content

Information about teams, tournaments, and matches may come from third-party sources. The names, logos, and trademarks of teams and competitions belong to their respective owners.

---

## 7. Privacy

The use of your personal data is governed by our Privacy Policy, which forms an integral part of these Terms. By accepting these Terms, you also accept our Privacy Policy.

---

## 8. Service Availability

### 8.1 No Guarantee of Availability

The Service is provided "as is" and "as available". We do not guarantee:

- Uninterrupted availability of the Service
- The absence of errors or defects
- That the Service will meet all your expectations

### 8.2 Maintenance

We reserve the right to:

- Perform scheduled or emergency maintenance
- Modify, suspend, or discontinue features
- Update the Service without prior notice

---

## 9. Limitation of Liability

### 9.1 Exclusion of Damages

To the maximum extent permitted by law, we shall not be liable for:

- Indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages
- Loss of data, profits, or opportunities
- Service interruptions
- Actions of other users
- Any activity conducted outside the Platform (including prizes organized by third parties)

### 9.2 Liability Cap

Our total liability shall not exceed the amount you have paid for the Service in the last 12 months, or $0 if you have made no payments.

---

## 10. Indemnification

You agree to indemnify and hold harmless the Platform, its operators, employees, and affiliates from any claim, damage, loss, or expense (including legal fees) arising from:

- Your use of the Service
- Your violation of these Terms
- Your violation of third-party rights
- Content you generate or share

---

## 11. Termination

### 11.1 By the User

You may close your account at any time by contacting us or using the options available on the Platform.

### 11.2 By Us

We reserve the right to suspend or terminate your account if:

- You violate these Terms
- You engage in fraudulent or suspicious activities
- You do not use the account for a prolonged period
- For any other reason at our discretion

### 11.3 Effects of Termination

Upon termination:

- You will lose access to your account and associated data
- Clauses that by their nature should survive will remain in effect

---

## 12. Modifications

### 12.1 Changes to the Terms

We may modify these Terms at any time. We will notify you of material changes through:

- A notice on the Platform
- An email to your registered address
- A request for re-acceptance upon login

### 12.2 Acceptance of Changes

Continued use of the Service after notification constitutes acceptance of the new Terms.

---

## 13. General Provisions

### 13.1 Governing Law

These Terms are governed by the laws of the Republic of Colombia, without prejudice to consumer protection regulations in your jurisdiction that may apply.

### 13.2 Dispute Resolution

For any dispute related to these Terms or the Service:

1. We will first attempt to resolve it amicably
2. If not possible, the parties agree to submit to the competent courts of Bogota, Colombia

### 13.3 Severability

If any provision of these Terms is deemed invalid, the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect.

### 13.4 Waiver

The failure to exercise any right under these Terms does not constitute a waiver of that right.

### 13.5 Entire Agreement

These Terms, together with the Privacy Policy, constitute the entire agreement between you and us regarding the use of the Service.

---

## 14. Contact

For questions about these Terms of Service, you may contact us at:

- **Email:** soporte@picks4all.com

---

*By using the Platform, you confirm that you have read, understood, and accepted these Terms of Service.*

# Privacy Policy

**Last updated:** January 25, 2026
**Version:** 2026-01-25

---

## 1. Introduction

This Privacy Policy describes how the Picks4All platform ("the Platform", "the Service", "we", "us") collects, uses, stores, and protects your personal information.

We are committed to protecting your privacy and being transparent about our data practices. By using our Service, you agree to the practices described in this Policy.

---

## 2. Information We Collect

### 2.1 Information You Provide

**Registration data:**
- Email address
- Username
- Display name
- Password (stored securely using hashing)

**Optional profile data:**
- Preferred time zone
- Notification preferences

**Service usage data:**
- Predictions made in pools
- Pool participation (as host or player)
- Interactions with other users

### 2.2 Automatically Collected Information

**Technical data:**
- IP address
- Browser type and version
- Operating system
- Device identifiers
- Pages visited and time spent

**Log data:**
- Date and time of access
- Actions performed (login, pool creation, etc.)
- Errors and system events

### 2.3 Third-Party Information

If you choose to sign in with Google:
- Google user ID
- Name associated with your Google account
- Google email address

We do not access your contacts, calendar, Drive files, or any other Google data beyond what is mentioned above.

---

## 3. How We Use Your Information

We use your information to:

### 3.1 Provide the Service
- Create and manage your account
- Enable your participation in pools
- Calculate scores and rankings
- Send notifications about relevant activity

### 3.2 Improve the Service
- Analyze usage patterns (in aggregate)
- Identify and fix bugs
- Develop new features
- Optimize performance and user experience

### 3.3 Communications
- Send transactional emails (password recovery, etc.)
- Notify you of changes to the Terms or Privacy Policy
- Send marketing communications (only with your consent)

### 3.4 Security and Compliance
- Detect and prevent fraud or abuse
- Comply with legal obligations
- Protect our rights and those of other users
- Maintain audit logs

---

## 4. Legal Basis for Processing

We process your information under the following legal bases:

| Legal Basis | Application |
|-------------|-------------|
| **Consent** | Marketing communications, optional cookies |
| **Contract performance** | Providing the service, managing your account |
| **Legitimate interest** | Security, fraud prevention, service improvement |
| **Legal obligation** | Compliance with laws and regulations |

---

## 5. How We Share Your Information

### 5.1 With Other Users

Within the Platform, other users may see:
- Your username and display name
- Your position on leaderboards
- Your predictions (after each match's deadline)
- Your participation history in shared pools

### 5.2 With Service Providers

We may share data with providers who help us operate the Service:

| Provider | Purpose | Data Shared |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| Hosting provider | Storage and servers | All service data |
| Email service | Sending emails | Email, name |
| Authentication service (Google) | Social login | Session ID |

These providers are contractually obligated to protect your data and may only use it for the specified purposes.

### 5.3 For Legal Reasons

We may disclose information if we believe in good faith that it is necessary to:
- Comply with a legal obligation
- Respond to valid legal requests (court orders, etc.)
- Protect the safety of users or the public
- Defend our legal rights

### 5.4 Business Transfers

In the event of a merger, acquisition, or sale of assets, your information may be transferred as part of the transaction. We will notify you of any change in ownership or use of your information.

### 5.5 What We Do NOT Do

- We **DO NOT sell** your personal information
- We **DO NOT share** data with advertisers for targeted advertising
- We **DO NOT use** your data for profiling for third-party commercial purposes

---

## 6. Data Retention

### 6.1 Retention Periods

| Data Type | Retention Period |
|-----------|------------------|
| Account data | While the account is active + 30 days |
| Predictions and scores | While the account is active |
| Security logs | 12 months |
| Audit logs | 24 months |
| Deleted pool data | 90 days (for possible restoration) |

### 6.2 Account Deletion

When you request account deletion:
- Your personal data will be deleted within 30 days
- Anonymized data may be retained for statistical analysis
- Audit logs are maintained for the legally required period

---

## 7. Your Rights

Depending on your location, you may have the following rights:

### 7.1 General Rights

- **Access:** Request a copy of your personal data
- **Rectification:** Correct inaccurate or incomplete data
- **Deletion:** Request the deletion of your data
- **Portability:** Receive your data in a structured format
- **Objection:** Object to certain types of processing

### 7.2 For Users in Colombia

Under Law 1581 of 2012 (Habeas Data Law), you have the right to:
- Know, update, and rectify your information
- Request proof of the authorization granted
- Be informed about the use of your data
- Revoke authorization and/or request deletion
- File complaints with the SIC (Superintendency of Industry and Commerce)

### 7.3 For Users in the European Union

Under the GDPR, in addition to general rights, you have the right to:
- Withdraw your consent at any time
- File complaints with your local data protection authority
- Not be subject to automated decisions with legal effects

### 7.4 For Users in the United States (California)

Under the CCPA, California residents have the right to:
- Know what personal information is collected
- Know whether their information is sold or shared
- Opt out of data sales (we do not sell data)
- Not be discriminated against for exercising their rights

### 7.5 How to Exercise Your Rights

To exercise any of these rights, contact us at:
- **Email:** privacidad@picks4all.com

We will respond to your request within the applicable legal timeframes (generally 15-30 days).

---

## 8. Data Security

### 8.1 Technical Measures

We implement security measures including:
- Encryption of data in transit (HTTPS/TLS)
- Password encryption with secure algorithms (bcrypt)
- Authentication tokens with expiration
- Protection against common attacks (XSS, CSRF, SQL injection)

### 8.2 Organizational Measures

- Restricted access to personal data (principle of least privilege)
- Internal information security policies
- Monitoring of access and suspicious activities

### 8.3 Limitations

No system is 100% secure. Although we strive to protect your information, we cannot guarantee absolute security. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your credentials.

---

## 9. International Transfers

### 9.1 Data Location

Our servers may be located in different countries. By using the Service, you consent to the transfer of your data to these locations.

### 9.2 Safeguards

For transfers outside your jurisdiction, we implement:
- Approved standard contractual clauses
- Impact assessments when required
- Data processing agreements with providers

---

## 10. Minors

### 10.1 Minimum Age

The Service is intended for users **13 years of age or older**.

### 10.2 Users Under 18

If you are between 13 and 17 years old, you must have the consent of your parents or legal guardians to use the Service.

### 10.3 Users Under 13

We do not intentionally collect information from children under 13. If we discover that we have collected data from a child under 13, we will delete that information immediately.

If you are a parent/guardian and believe your child under 13 has provided information, please contact us.

---

## 11. Cookies and Similar Technologies

### 11.1 Current Use

Currently, the Platform uses:
- **Browser LocalStorage:** To store your session token
- **We do not use tracking cookies or third-party cookies**

### 11.2 Future Changes

If we implement additional cookies in the future:
- We will inform you by updating this Policy
- We will request your consent when required
- We will provide options to manage your preferences

---

## 12. Third-Party Links

The Platform may contain links to third-party websites. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of these sites. We recommend reviewing their privacy policies before providing them with information.

---

## 13. Changes to This Policy

### 13.1 Notification of Changes

We may update this Privacy Policy periodically. We will notify you of material changes through:
- A prominent notice on the Platform
- An email to your registered address
- A request for re-acceptance upon login

### 13.2 Version History

We maintain a history of previous versions of this Policy, available upon request.

---

## 14. Contact

For questions, requests, or complaints related to this Privacy Policy:

**Email:** privacidad@picks4all.com
**Response time:** We strive to respond to all requests within 15 business days.

---

## 15. Additional Information for Colombia

### 15.1 Data Controller

The data controller for your personal data is the operator of the Picks4All Platform.

### 15.2 Purposes

The purposes of data processing are described in Section 3 of this Policy.

### 15.3 Data Subject Rights

Your rights as a data subject are described in Section 7.2.

### 15.4 Supervisory Authority

You may file complaints with:
- **Superintendency of Industry and Commerce (SIC)**
- Carrera 13 No. 27-00, Bogota D.C., Colombia
- www.sic.gov.co

---

*By using the Platform, you confirm that you have read, understood, and accepted this Privacy Policy.*
